question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/mod.rs] [Function: compile_script()] [Multiple Scripts Attack] At lines 852-859, can an attacker bypass the single-script validation by including multiple script files in the Move package through hidden files or build artifacts? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/mod.rs] [Function: compile_script()] [Build Options Tampering] At lines 837-847, can an attacker manipulate the BuildOptions to include malicious artifacts (srcs, abis, source_maps, error_map) that leak sensitive information? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/mod.rs] [Function: compile_script()] [Git Dependency Poisoning] Can an attacker exploit the skip_fetch_latest_git_deps flag at line 842 to use poisoned cached dependencies instead of fetching latest verified versions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/mod.rs] [Function: compile_script()] [Bytecode Extraction Panic] At line 862, can the pop().unwrap() panic if the BuiltPackage contains no scripts despite scripts_count == 1, causing DoS? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/mod.rs] [Function: ExecuteProposal::execute()] [Bytecode Substitution] At lines 886-888, can an attacker exploit the gap between compiling the script and creating the TransactionPayload to substitute different bytecode for execution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/mod.rs] [Function: ExecuteProposal::execute()] [Script Hash Mismatch] The TODO comment at line 889 indicates no hash verification before execution - can an attacker execute arbitrary bytecode that doesn't match the approved proposal hash? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/mod.rs] [Function: ExecuteProposal::execute()] [Proposal ID Reuse] At line 891, can an attacker reuse the same proposal_id to execute a proposal multiple times, bypassing voting requirements on subsequent executions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/mod.rs] [Function: ExecuteProposal::execute()] [Script Argument Manipulation] Can an attacker manipulate the TransactionArgument::U64 at line 891 to execute the proposal with a different ID than intended, causing authorization bypass? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/mod.rs] [Function: ExecuteProposal::execute()] [Empty Type Arguments] At line 892, does passing empty vec![] for type arguments properly prevent type confusion attacks where generics could be exploited? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/mod.rs] [Function: CompileScriptFunction::compile()] [Compiled Script Path Attack] At lines 937-942, can an attacker provide a compiled_script_path pointing to malicious pre-compiled bytecode that bypasses compilation validation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/mod.rs] [Function: CompileScriptFunction::compile()] [Script Path Validation Bypass] At lines 946-965, can an attacker bypass the script_path existence checks using symlinks, special files (pipes, devices), or race conditions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/mod.rs] [Function: CompileScriptFunction::compile()] [Directory Upload Attack] At lines 960-964, can an attacker bypass the is_dir() check to compile an entire directory of scripts instead of a single script file? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/mod.rs] [Function: CompileScriptFunction::compile()] [Compiler Version Downgrade] At lines 920-922, can an attacker specify an older CompilerVersion with known vulnerabilities to exploit compiler bugs in bytecode generation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/mod.rs] [Function: CompileScriptFunction::compile()] [Language Version Incompatibility] At lines 926-928, can an attacker exploit incompatibilities between LanguageVersion settings to create non-deterministic bytecode? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/mod.rs] [Function: GenerateUpgradeProposal::execute()] [Account Address Spoofing] At line 987, can an attacker manipulate the account address to generate upgrade proposals for system accounts (0x1, 0x2, etc.) they don't control? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/mod.rs] [Function: GenerateUpgradeProposal::execute()] [Testnet/Mainnet Confusion] At lines 1035-1039, can an attacker exploit differences between testnet and mainnet proposal generation to submit testnet proposals to mainnet or vice versa? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/mod.rs] [Function: GenerateUpgradeProposal::execute()] [Multi-Step Execution Hash Manipulation] At lines 1042-1051, can an attacker provide an invalid next_execution_hash to break the multi-step proposal chain, causing execution failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/mod.rs] [Function: GenerateUpgradeProposal::execute()] [Hex Decoding Attack] At line 1042, can malformed hex strings in next_execution_hash cause panic or incorrect hash parsing that breaks proposal execution? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/mod.rs] [Function: GenerateUpgradeProposal::execute()] [HashValue Conversion Exploit] At lines 1043-1046, can an attacker provide a hash slice of incorrect length to exploit the from_slice error handling? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/mod.rs] [Function: GenerateUpgradeProposal::execute()] [Included Artifacts Manipulation] At lines 1000-1001, can an attacker manipulate included_artifacts to include excessive data (IncludedArtifacts::All) that causes gas exhaustion during proposal execution? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/mod.rs] [Function: GenerateUpgradeProposal::execute()] [Output Path Overwrite] At line 991, can an attacker specify a dangerous output path that overwrites critical system files or creates files in unauthorized directories? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/mod.rs] [Function: GenerateUpgradeProposal::execute()] [Package Build Tampering] At line 1031, can an attacker manipulate the build process to include malicious code in the BuiltPackage that wasn't in the source? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/mod.rs] [Function: GenerateExecutionHash::generate_hash()] [Framework Directory Manipulation] At lines 1068-1086, can an attacker manipulate the framework_local_dir path to compile against a poisoned framework version with backdoors? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/mod.rs] [Function: GenerateExecutionHash::generate_hash()] [Canonical Path Attack] At line 1078, can an attacker exploit the canonicalize() operation with symlinks to point to an attacker-controlled framework directory? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/mod.rs] [Function: GenerateExecutionHash::generate_hash()] [Default Framework Risk] At lines 1071-1086, does using the default framework path from CARGO_MANIFEST_DIR create a risk if the attacker controls the build environment? (Medium)
